net.jawr.web.resource.bundle.handler

Interface ClientSideHandlerGenerator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClientSideHandlerGeneratorImpl

    public interface ClientSideHandlerGenerator
    Provides methods to generate a javascript equivalent of a resourcehandler, used to generate links in a non dynamic page where taglibs cannot be used.
    Author:
    Jordi Hernández Sellés, Ibrahim Chaehoi

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String DEBUG_SCRIPT_TEMPLATE
      The script template for debug mode
      static String SCRIPT_TEMPLATE
      The script template

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      StringBuffer getClientSideBundles(Map<String,String> variantMap, boolean useGzip)
      Returns the part of the script that creates all instances of ResourceBundle javascript objects for a given resourcehandler.
      StringBuffer getClientSideHandlerScript(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Builds a javascript script that can be used to include bundles in non dynamic html pages.
      void init(JawrConfig config, List<JoinableResourceBundle> globalBundles, List<JoinableResourceBundle> contextBundles)
      Initializes the ClientSideHandlerGenerator

      • getClientSideHandlerScript

        StringBuffer getClientSideHandlerScript(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Builds a javascript script that can be used to include bundles in non dynamic html pages.
        Parameters:
        request - the request
        Returns:
        the content of the javascript

      • getClientSideBundles

        StringBuffer getClientSideBundles(Map<String,String> variantMap,
                                boolean useGzip)
        Returns the part of the script that creates all instances of ResourceBundle javascript objects for a given resourcehandler.
        Parameters:
        variantMap - the variant map
        useGzip - the flag indicating if we must gip or not the content
        Returns:
        the part of the script that creates all instances of ResourceBundle javascript objects
